meanings.definition: A person who is dishonest or a criminal.
meanings.sent1: The crook stole money from the bank.
meanings.sent2: The police caught the crook red-handed.
meanings.sent3: The crook tried to sell fake watches on the street.
meanings.sent4: Beware of the crook who pretends to be your friend.
meanings.sent5: The town was relieved when the crook was finally arrested.

meanings.definition: A bend or curve in something.
meanings.sent1: The tree had a crook in its trunk.
meanings.sent2: She straightened the crook in the wire to make it even.
meanings.sent3: The crook in the road made for a fun rollercoaster ride.
meanings.sent4: The crook in the river created a peaceful bend in the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The crook in the path led us to a hidden meadow.

meanings.sent1: He used his hands to crook the wire into a circle.
meanings.sent2: She had to crook the hose to fit it around the corner.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to crook the metal spoon with his mind.
meanings.sent4: The blacksmith would crook the iron bars into intricate designs.
meanings.sent5: The tailor would carefully crook the fabric to create elegant drapes.
